title: Unable to load DLL 'libSkiaSharp' on Linux using version 1.60.0
body:
### Description

I have a .Net Core 2.0 WebAPI Project which uses a class library which references SkiaSharp 1.60.0 NuGet. When I publish my project to Ubuntu-16.04-x64 the file "libSkiaSharp.so" is missing and I'm getting an exception: "Unable to load DLL 'libSkiaSharp'". I came across the same issue here #288 but it didn't fix it.

I tried using "Avalonia.Skia.Linux.Natives 1.57.1.4" but it only works with Skia's 1.57.1 version and I want to use the latest 1.60.0.

Can you please tell me if and how this issue was solved?


### Actual Behavior

Gets an error "Unable to load DLL 'libSkiaSharp'"

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:  1.60.0
- IDE:  Visual Studio 2017
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - Linux:  Ubuntu 16.04
